docs.title: Home
docs.text:
TVApp2

This documentation is related to the github repository for TVApp2; a NodeJS powered application which allows you to fetch M3U playlists and EPG guide data from various popular online IPTV services such as TheTvApp, TVPass, and MoveOnJoy. These services provide high-quality and premium channels available as Live TV.

This documentation covers the following:

  • How to install and configure TVApp2
  • Managing your TVApp2 docker image
  • Building your own docker image
  • Traefik and Authentik Integration

docs.title: Conventions
docs.text: This documentation use some symbols for illustration purposes. Before you read on, please make sure you've made yourself familiar with the following list of conventions:

docs.title: Release Type
docs.text:
The tag symbol in conjunction with a version number denotes when a specific feature or behavior was added. Make sure you're at least on this version if you want to use it.

stable

beta

docs.title: Controls
docs.text:
These icons define what type of control a specified setting uses.

toggle

textbox

dropdown

button

slider

color wheel

docs.title: – Default Value
docs.text:
This defines what the default value for a setting is.

Specified setting has a default value

Specified setting has no default value and is empty

Specified setting is automatically computed by the app

docs.title: – Command
docs.text:
This defines a command

Specified setting has a default value

docs.title: – Experimental
docs.text: Anything listed with this icon are features or functionality that are still in development and may change in future versions.

docs.title: – Required value
docs.text: Items listed with this symbol indicate that they are required to be set.

docs.title: – Customization
docs.text: This symbol denotes that the item described is a customization which affects the overall look of the app.

docs.title: – 3<sup>rd</sup> Party
docs.text: This symbol denotes that the item described is classified as something that changes the overall functionality of the plugin.

docs.title: – Metadata property
docs.text: This symbol denotes that the item described is a metadata property, which can be used in Markdown documents as part of the front matter definition.

docs.title: – Configurable Setting
docs.text: This symbol denotes that an item is configurable by the user

docs.title: – Multiple instances
docs.text: This symbol denotes that the plugin supports multiple instances, i.e, that it can be used multiple times in the plugins setting in mkdocs.yml.

docs.title: – Optional feature
docs.text: Most of the features are hidden behind feature flags, which means they must be explicitly enabled via mkdocs.yml. This allows for the existence of potentially orthogonal features.

docs.title: – Backers only
docs.text: The pumping heart symbol denotes that a specific feature or behavior is only available to backers. Normal users will not have access to this particular item.
